Management Analyst 3_Tumwater - job post Washington State Patrol 330 reviews Tumwater, WA $4,541 - $6,105 a month -  Full-time You must create an Indeed account before continuing to the company website to apply Apply on company site save-icon Job details Salary $4,541 - $6,105 a month Job Type Full-time Description If you answer YES to any of these questions this is the perfect opportunity for you! Are you a self-starter? Do you thrive in a team environment? Do you want a position with career growth opportunities ? About the Agency & Division: The WSP actively supports Diversity, Equity, Inclusion in the workplace, and is an Equal Opportunity Employer . The WSP strives to create and foster an inclusive culture inspiring everyone to be their authentic selves, speak openly, and be courageous. The WSP continues to focus on equitable hiring, training, and promotional practices and policies through innovative recruitment and retention solutions. Partnering with our communities helps the WSP provide the best in public safety services now and into the future. Division: The Property Management Division (PMD) serves three primary functions for the agency. These functions are Facilities Management, Fleet Management, and Supply Management. Duties The Management Analyst 3 position supports the Property Management Division by analyzing management problems, developing strategies, conducting research, formulating recommendations, and coordinating implementation of strategic and long-range planning activities in areas such as business and organizational planning, budgeting, operations, policy issues, and proposed legislation. Some examples of the critically necessary work created by this position includes writing complex briefing papers; conducts studies and cost benefit analyses; and completes legislative mandated reports including but not limited to reports related to greenhouse gas emissions, strategic reduction plans, etc. for sustainability; prepares fuel and vehicle maintenance budget packages; as well as composes the operation plan and risk assessment. This position will be responsible for supervising the daily activities of the Fiscal Technician 2 and Data Consultant 1. Assigns task to personnel via verbal instruction, written instruction, and with electronic communications. Provides performance documentation and feedback to assigned personnel by using oral and written communications and through the evaluation process. This position may interact with all division employees, other WSP staff, allied public safety agencies, other agency staff, and vendors to accomplish assigned work. This position provides professional and technical advice to management and/or other regarding complex, multi-dimensional issues impacting all departments, programs, and policies. This position organizes, trains, and leads project teams conducing complex research and analysis, formulating recommendations, and coordinating implementation of strategic and long-range planning activities. The Management Analyst 3 monitors proposed or pending changes in federal programs, law, rules, regulations, eligibility criteria, etc. in terms of potential impact on programs, rules, laws, and policies, recommending appropriate response and/or action.? Our new teammate will be able to: Write reports, studies, and briefing papers Research and analyze data Supervise employees Formulate process improvements and recommendations Special Projects Qualifications Required Qualifications: Must possess a valid, unrestricted Washington State Driver's License. Bachelor’s degree in business administration, public administration, law, public health, health administration, or a related field and two to three years of experience conducting research and analyzing policies, laws, rules, or regulations OR prior business or work experience can be substituted for formal education. Proficient use of Microsoft Excel: Use spreadsheet software to create, modify, print and format spreadsheets, find data, spell check, and work with complex functions and formulas. Proficient use of Microsoft Word: Use word processing software to create format, edit, preview, print and save documents. Use standard functions to select, edit, copy, paste, format, and spell check. Create bulleted and numbered lists, indent and align paragraphs, and use border and shading features. Familiarity working with forms. Proficient use of Microsoft Outlook: Compose, send, and respond to electronic mail. Utilize calendar and scheduling functions. Proficient use of PowerPoint: Create new and update existing presentations. Proficient use of SharePoint: Post documents, conduct surveys, and update library contents. Ability to think critically and analytically. Ability to work with large datasets. Understand impact of rules and policies. Able to prioritize competing work demands; identify expected deliverables, and evaluate effectiveness of efforts. Be proactive and self-motivated. Possess excellent communication skills, both orally and written. Communicate with all levels of staff, vendors, and other agencies. Able to maintain confidentiality of sensitive data. Good organizational skills. Safety: Minimize accidents in the workplace. Carefully organize personal workspace to minimize the likelihood of an accident or other unsafe conditions. Adhere to safety policies. Carefully observe and report potential hazards or breaches of security while in the workplace or in the field. Follow all relevant policies and procedures Preferred Qualifications: Experience processing invoices and reviewing accounting data in accordance with State Administrative and Accounting Manual (SAAM) and Generally Accepted Accounting Principles (GAAP). Experience reconciling accounts. Ensure necessary documents are included with voucher and credit card transactions. Preference would be given to candidates who are able to perform complex functions in Excel such as conditional formatting, pivot tables, import/export of data, text to columns, v-lookup, network days, and concatenate. Familiar with the use of templates and multiple tabbed worksheets. Preference would be given to candidates who are proficient with Visio, Publisher, ArcGIS, and Adobe Professional. Wh y work for the Washington State Patrol? A healthy life/work balance by offering flexible schedules and telework options for most positions. An Infants at Work Program that is based on the long-term health values of infant-parent bonding and breastfeeding newborns. Continuous growth and development opportunities. Opportunities to serve your community and make an impact through meaningful work Employment opportunities that recognize military veterans and/or military spouse per Governor Executive Order 19-01 Qualification for the Public Loan Forgiveness Program Supplemental Information This recruitment may be used to fill multiple vacancies. For more information regarding how to apply for this position , please click here (Download PDF reader). WSP Policy 1.04.020 - WSP does not engage in, or assist with, civil immigration enforcement, therefore; In no stage of the hiring process will the immigration status of family members of the candidate be investigated by the Washington State Patrol.
